description: A bustling port town on Fish-Man Island where many merfolk and fish-men live and work. It features the main street with shops and the famous Mermaid Cafe. This is one of the primary population centers on the island.

keyEvents.title: Arrival at Coral Hill Main Street
keyEvents.description: Camie, Luffy, and Usopp explore Coral Hill's main street, the bustling central district of Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: First detailed look at daily life in one of Fish-Man Island's main population centers.

keyEvents.title: Shyarly's Public Prophecy
keyEvents.description: Madam Shyarly runs into the streets of Coral Hill to publicly declare her prophecy that Luffy will destroy Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: The location where the prophecy becomes public knowledge, creating fear among the island's residents.

description: A large factory on Fish-Man Island that produces candy as monthly tribute to Big Mom of the Four Emperors. The factory bears Big Mom's pirate flag, signifying her protection of the island. It is located in Candy Factory Town on the northwest side of Fish-Man Island.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of the Candy Factory
keyEvents.description: The group encounters the Candy Factory and learns about Big Mom's protection arrangement with Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: First visual introduction of Big Mom's influence on Fish-Man Island, foreshadowing future conflicts.

keyEvents.title: Big Mom's Protection Explained
keyEvents.description: Pappag explains that Big Mom took over protection of Fish-Man Island after Whitebeard's death, demanding monthly candy tribute unlike Whitebeard's benevolent protection.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the new political situation post-Marineford War and the transactional nature of Big Mom's protection.

statusHistory.reason: Operating factory producing candy for Big Mom

description: A wealthy, upscale district on Fish-Man Island where affluent residents like Pappag live. The name is a portmanteau of 'gyo' (魚, meaning fish) and Beverly Hills, reflecting its status as a luxury neighborhood. Features expensive mansions and estates.

keyEvents.title: Arrival at Gyoverly Hills
keyEvents.description: The group arrives at Gyoverly Hills, the wealthy district where Pappag's mansion is located.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the economic disparity within Fish-Man Island society and establishes Pappag's wealth.

statusHistory.reason: Functioning wealthy district on Fish-Man Island

description: A luxurious mansion in Gyoverly Hills shaped like a giant seashell, owned by the fashion designer Pappag. The first floor houses a Criminal brand clothing store, while the upper floors serve as Pappag's residence. The mansion reflects Pappag's success and wealth from his fashion empire.

keyEvents.title: Pappag's Mansion Revealed
keyEvents.description: Pappag shows off his luxurious seashell-shaped mansion with a Criminal brand store on the first floor.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Pappag's success and provides a temporary home base for some Straw Hats.

statusHistory.reason: Pappag's active residence and business location
